techmeme.title: Sources: Opal, previously Opal Camera, which makes $300 webcams, raised a $60M Series B led by OpenAI Startup Fund and plans to make new OpenAI-powered devices (The Information)
Disney CEO Bob Iger says the company's password sharing crackdown will kick off "in earnest" in September, after announcing paid sharing in February 2024 (Emma Roth/The Verge)
Imec, one of the top chip R&D companies, reports several breakthroughs for printing logic and memory chips in a joint ASML lab using ASML's new High NA tool (Toby Sterling/Reuters)
Sources: in 2017 and 2018, Intel and OpenAI executives discussed Intel buying a 15% stake for $1B in cash, but CEO Bob Swan did not go forward with the deal (Max A. Cherney/Reuters)
The UK Online Safety Bill, set to take effect in 2025, wouldn't address anti-immigrant lies on X and Telegram that fueled riots, even before it was watered down (Parmy Olson/Bloomberg)
